Description: Rim sherd (mended from four fragments) of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved at rim, glazed black below; part of two lotus flowers and one rosette in added red and white; exterior: billet and dot pattern at rim between brown lines; below painted decoration consisting of undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 32, no. 5, pl. XVII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 279, no. 770)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0822) (phase 2)
